title: Modi’s U.S. visit sends a big, if quiet, signal to China
description: Though the White House downplays it, Narendra Modi’s trip to Washington is about enhancing a partnership that includes stopping Beijing’s aggressive expansion.

title: The scale of the search for the missing submersible
description: The task is huge: Finding a craft the size of a minivan in an area twice the size of the state of Connecticut and up to 2½ miles deep.

title: A century later, the Titanic still fascinates. Here’s why.
description: The unique circumstances of the Titanic's shipwreck and its passengers' stories have inspired books, films, video games, musicals, endless debate — and exploration.

title: African leaders visited with a peace plan. Putin showed little interest.
description: Russia’s missile attack on Kyiv at the very moment the peace mission was on the ground conveyed disrespect to the seven-nation African delegation, including four presidents.

title: Ben Helfgott, Holocaust survivor and Olympic weightlifter, dies at 93
description: His entire life was a show of strength, from his endurance as a teenager in Nazi concentration camps to his exploits on the world's athletic stage.

title: Titanic submersible CEO had spoken about worry of vessel not surfacing
description: Months before Stockton Rush became one of the five people in a missing submersible, he acknowledged fears but said he didn’t think such expeditions were “very dangerous” at all.

title: Israeli settlers rampage through Palestinian village after Hamas shooting
description: Deadly violence hits a Palestinian village in the West Bank near Ramallah, a day after four Israelis were gunned down by Hamas gunmen near an Israeli settlement.

title: Who are the five missing passengers inside the ‘Titan’ submersible?
description: The five passengers aboard a submersible that disappeared on a quest to see the Titanic have hours of emergency oxygen left. Here's who they are and what we know.

title: Ukraine’s dreams of rebuilding run into reality of soaring costs
description: Cities like Kharkiv are making ambitious plans to rebuild but the war, and the destruction, continue with no end in sight.

title: German ISIS member gets 9 years after helping husband enslave woman he raped
description: Prosecutors said Nadine K. knew her husband was raping a Yazidi woman they enslaved. On Wednesday, a court found her guilty of crimes against humanity.

title: U.S. can send more aid to Ukraine thanks to $6.2 billion accounting error
description: The “valuation errors” will allow the Pentagon to send more weapons to Ukraine now before going to Congress to request more money.

title: Nations pledge billions in Ukraine reconstruction amid staggering need
description: While the E.U., Blinken and Sunak pledged more than $50 billion of the next few years, the World Bank estimates Ukraine's need to be nearly 10 times that amount.

title: At least 41 killed in Honduras women’s prison riot; security chief fired
description: President Xiomara Castro said the riots were instigated by street gangs “with the knowledge and acquiescence of security authorities.”

title: Ukraine live briefing: War recovery conference kicks off in London; U.S. overestimates aid by $6.2B
description: The Pentagon overrepresented the value of equipment it sent to Ukraine by $6.2 billion, the Biden administration said, allowing it to send Kyiv more weapons.

title: Kyiv clamps down on bunker rules after residents died outside locked shelter
description: Russia's recent relentless air assault on the capital of Ukraine revealed a shortage — and occasional mismanagement — of the most basic protection for residents: bomb shelters.

title: Ukrainians adjust to life with a constant threat from airstrikes
description: Sirens warning of Russian airstrikes are now routine in Kyiv. For some residents, that has led to potentially dangerous complacency, for others it has led to a fatalistic ennui.

title: In missing submersible and migrant disaster, a tale of two Pakistans
description: The two maritime tragedies that gripped attention in recent days could barely be more different.
